result.execSummary:
The defendant Theodore G Reese was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: *The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory costs, fees, surcharges (including DNA), and assessments within 60 days (by 1-15-16) or any remaining balance to convert civil judgment.
*STRAIGHT TIME with 2 days credit.  NO HUBER RELEASE OR ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore G Reese

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order signed and filed.

The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is denied.
The court intended the defendant to serve the sentence without release privileges.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Reserve Branch 21, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges in 15CM001855 and 15CM002202.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with Attorney Jessica Bellows.  
Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Hearing proceeded.  Statements made by the state, defense, and defendant.  

COUNT 1:  The Court orders the defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME with 2 days credit.  NO HUBER RELEASE OR ELECTRONIC MONITORING ALLOWED.

The Court orders the defendant to pay all applicable mandatory costs, fees, surcharges (including dna), and assessments within 60 days (by 1-15-16) or any remaining balance to convert civil judgment.  Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The State made disclosure on the record.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements by State.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing to allow defense counsel time to discuss statements made by the State with the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calenared for plea/sentencing. Newly appointed counsel in court. Discovery and offer provided. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussions of discovery placed on the record. Court ordered State to provide discovery to defense. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Theodore G Reese in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Protasiewicz.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24  for a Pretrial Conference.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/30/15 @ 1:30pm
